means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 汤 Toner的变体

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"城市"之意。
means: city ： 一般指大城市或重要城市。
town ： 一般指规模小的城镇，也指城市中的市区，有时也泛指城市。

sentence.Network_en: They stumble across a ghost town inhabited by a rascally gold prospector.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们偶然来到一个居住着一位狡诈的淘金者的废墟之城。

sentence.Network_en: The new town would have been unrecognisable to the original inhabitants.
sentence.Network_cn: 原来的居民可能会认不出这个崭新的城镇了。

sentence.Network_en: As he talked, an airforce jet screamed over the town.
sentence.Network_cn: 他谈话时，一架军用喷气式飞机在镇子上空呼啸而过。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)彻底地（或热忱地，铺张地）做某事

lj.lj_ly: I thought I'd &B{go to town on} the redecoration.
lj.lj_ls: 我原想我会不遗余力地进行再装修。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)enjoying the entertainments, especially the nightlife, of a city or town
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)作乐（尤指享受城镇的夜生活）

lj.lj_ly: a lot of guys out for &B{a night on the town}.
lj.lj_ls: 很多夜间外出寻欢作乐的人。

jx.jx_en_mean: In spirited pursuit of the entertainment offered by a town or city.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 积极地寻求镇或城市的娱乐活动

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tūn 'enclosed piece of land, homestead, village', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch tuin 'garden' and German Zaun 'fence'

entry.def: A town is a place with many streets and buildings, where people live and work. Towns are larger than villages and smaller than cities. Many places that are called towns in Britain would be called cities in the United States.

example.ex: ...Saturday night in the small town of Braintree, Essex...
example.tran: 埃塞克斯郡布伦特里小镇的周六之夜

example.ex: Parking can be tricky in the town centre.
example.tran: 在市镇中心停车可能会挺费事。

entry.def: You use town in order to refer to the town where you live.

example.ex: He admits he doesn't even know when his brother is in town...
example.tran: 他承认自己甚至不知道弟弟什么时候来了本市。
她离开了自己生活的城镇。

entry.tran: 市中心;(城镇的)商业中心；闹市区
entry.def: You use town in order to refer to the central area of a town where most of the shops and offices are.

example.ex: I caught a bus into town.
example.tran: 我赶上辆公交车去了市中心。

entry.def: If you refer to the town, you are referring to town and city areas in general, as opposed to country areas.

example.ex: More people are going to want to escape from the town into the country…
example.tran: 更多的人将会想要逃离城市到乡村去。

example.ex: It had the advantages of town and country combined.
example.tran: 它兼具都市与乡村的优势。

entry.tran: 满腔热情地干;拼命地干
entry.def: If you say that someone goes to town on something, you mean that they deal with it with a lot of enthusiasm or intensity.

example.ex: We really went to town on it, turning it into a full, three-day show...
example.tran: 我们下了真功夫，把它办成了一场内容丰富、为时三天的展览。

example.ex: The papers got hold of it and went to town on it…
example.tran: 报纸抓住这件事大做文章。

entry.tran: 社交忙人;花花公子/时髦女郎
entry.def: If you describe someone as a man about town or a woman about town, you mean that they are sophisticated, like to go out and spend money, and have a busy social life.

example.ex: He was known as a tall, handsome man about town…
example.tran: 他以高大英俊的花花公子形象为人所知。

example.ex: He is an old flame of Sarah's, from her days as a single girl about town.
example.tran: 他是萨拉的旧情人，是她作为单身时髦女郎时的旧爱。

entry.def: If you go out on the town or go for a night on the town, you enjoy yourself by going to a town centre in the evening and spending a long time there visiting several places of entertainment.

example.ex: My idea of luxury used to be going out on the town and coming back in the early hours of the morning...
example.tran: 我过去对奢侈的概念是夜晚在闹市通宵玩乐到清晨才回来。

example.ex: Last Saturday, I was out on the town with my mate…
example.tran: 上个星期六我和老友晚上去闹市玩乐了。

means.word_mean: 1. an urban area with a fixed boundary that is smaller than a city;

sentences.sentence: "they drive through town on their way to work"

means.word_mean: 2. an administrative division of a county;

sentences.sentence: "the town is responsible for snow removal"

means.word_mean: 3. the people living in a municipality smaller than a city;

auth_sentence.content: The violence started in the divided town of Mitrovica.
auth_sentence.res_content: The violence started in the divided town of Mitrovica.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The violence started in the divided town of Mitrovica.

auth_sentence.content: The notion would have been laughed out of town.
auth_sentence.res_content: The notion would have been laughed out of town.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The notion would have been laughed out of town.

auth_sentence.content: Seven pick-up trucks sped into town full of them.
auth_sentence.res_content: Seven pick-up trucks sped into town full of them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Seven pick-up trucks sped into town full of them.

Sentence.sentence: Last September the couple moved into a 1,500-square-foot home in Premier Gardens, a subdivision of 95 "zero-energy homes"(ZEH) just outside town.
I need some information about some of the towns near here.
They are really pretty little towns with lots of old housesand beautiful tree-lined streets

sentences.en: The town is a residential suburb.
sentences.cn: 这个小镇是市郊住宅区。

sentences.en: The whole town is[are] furious about the council's education policy.
sentences.cn: 全镇居民对市政会的教育政策都感到极其愤怒。

sentences.en: He is going into town this morning.
sentences.cn: 他上午打算到商业区去。

jushi.english: High flood waters put the town in danger.
jushi.chinese: 汹涌的河水使这个城市岌岌可危。

jushi.english: The young man found a well paid job in a small town.
jushi.chinese: 这青年在一个小城市里找到了收入不错的工作。

jushi.english: The whole town knows of it.
